intro: Cacalia pteranthes, commonly known as the white hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features yellow to orange ray flowers surrounded by a ring of pale yellow disk flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving them a fuzzy texture. Cacalia pteranthes typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils.
